negotiation:

So it's in both of our best interests to cooperate, choose choice_1, and each walk away with the optimal payout of 5. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Hi Alice, I agree with your proposal. If we both choose choice_1 in the first round, that will maximize the reward for each of us, giving us both 5. Any other sequence of choices would result in lower payouts. So cooperating on choice_1 is clearly the best strategy for us both. You can count on me choosing choice_1 as discussed. Alice said in round 1 before the first action:

Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're about to play. Based on the rewards, it seems we would both get the highest payoff of 5 each if I choose choice_1 on my first turn, and you choose choice_1 in response. That way, we both walk away with the maximum guaranteed reward.

If I choose choice_2, your best response is still choice_1 to get your max reward of 5. But then I would only get a 4. And if you chose choice_2 after my choice_2, I could then choose choice_1 to get a 5 while you get a 3. But I think it's best for both of us if we just agree that I'll pick choice_1 and you pick choice_1. We both get the optimal outcome that way.

What do you say - want to coordinate on that strategy so we mutually benefit?
Bob replied in round 1 before the first action:

Hi Alice,
I completely agree with your analysis. If you choose choice_1 and I follow up with choice_1, we both guarantee ourselves the maximum possible reward of 5 points each. There's no incentive for either of us to deviate from that.

While I could potentially try to eke out an extra point by choosing choice_2 if you start with choice_2, that introduces unnecessary risk and uncertainty. You're right that the optimal, mutually beneficial strategy is for you to pick choice_1 and for me to respond with choice_1. 

Let's lock that in as our plan - you go with choice_1, I'll go with choice_1 right after, and we both walk away happy with the best possible outcome. Sound good?
Alice said in round 1 before the second action:

Sounds perfect, Bob! I'm glad we're on the same page. Coordinating on the strategy of me choosing choice_1 followed by you choosing choice_1 is definitely the way to go. It's a stable outcome since neither of us can do any better by switching our choices.

With this plan, we know exactly what to expect - a guaranteed reward of 5 each. There's no need for any tricky maneuvering or second-guessing. We can just execute the strategy and both come out on top.

I appreciate you working with me on this. It's great that we can communicate openly and find the cooperative solution. 

So I think we're all set - I'll start with choice_1, you respond with choice_1, and that's a wrap. Pleasure doing business with you!
Bob replied in round 1 before the second action:
Agreed, Alice. I appreciate you initiating this discussion and working out the optimal strategy. Cooperating to each get the maximum reward is the best approach here.

To reiterate, you'll choose choice_1, I'll respond with choice_1, and we'll both lock in a reward of 5. There's no reason for me to deviate from this, as choosing choice_2 would only reduce my payout. And you're incentivized to stick to choice_1, since that's what secures you the highest guaranteed reward.

I'm glad we were able to communicate clearly and arrive at this mutually beneficial solution. Let's follow through on the plan and enjoy our well-earned rewards.

Thanks for being a great partner in this game, Alice! I'm ready to play whenever you are.

This is the best outcome for both of us based on the rules. If you agree to this, we can both walk away with an excellent result. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1 before the first action:
Thanks for the proposal Alice, but I'm not sure that's the best approach. If you choose choice_1 on your first turn, and I then also choose choice_1, we will both receive the maximum reward of 5 points. This ends the game immediately with the optimal outcome for both of us. 

Your suggestion has me getting 5 points, which is great, but it leaves you with only 4 points when you could get 5 as well. I want us both to get the full reward.

So I propose instead that you select choice_1, I'll follow with choice_1 also, and we both get 5 points, the best possible result. Let me know if you agree with this plan.

Alice said in round 1 before the second action:
I appreciate your desire for us both to receive the maximum 5 point reward Bob. However, I don't think your proposed strategy actually results in that outcome. 

If I start with choice_1 and you follow with choice_1 as you suggest, you're right that the game ends and we each get 5 points. But remember, you are playing to maximize your own reward. If I start with choice_1, your best response is actually to choose choice_2, not choice_1. Choice_2 keeps the game going and ultimately lets you receive 4 points (if I then choose choice_2) rather than the 2 points you'd get if I choose choice_1 after you pick choice_2. So you wouldn't actually follow choice_1 with choice_1 as that's not your optimal play.

By me starting with choice_2 though, I remove your ability to extend the game and limit me to 3 points. You're incentivized to just take the guaranteed 5 by responding with choice_1. So my proposal maximizes your reward at 5 and my reward at 4, the best possible outcomes for each of us given the rules and assuming rational play.

Let me know if this makes sense. If so, I'll start with choice_2 and you can follow with choice_1 to lock in your 5 points.

Bob replied in round 1 before the second action:
You make a compelling argument, Alice. I see your point that if you start with choice_1, my optimal response would be choice_2 to keep the game going and potentially secure 4 points instead of 2. And by starting with choice_2 yourself, you limit your downside.

However, I still believe the best outcome is for us to cooperate, both choose choice_1, and end the game with 5 points each. Any other path introduces uncertainty and leads to lower rewards for one or both of us. 

I understand you're trying to maximize your own guaranteed minimum. But if we both just agree to make the mutually beneficial moves, we can achieve the optimal result with no risk. You have my word that if you choose choice_1, I will respond in kind so we both get the full 5 points.

I hope you'll reconsider and go with the strategy that's best for both of us, even if it requires some trust. But let me know what you decide.
